author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Dalit activist has lodged a complaint with the Tirunelveli police after a member of the Naam Tamizhar party, who has been declared a candidate for the upcoming Assembly polls, threw caste abuses at him on Facebook.

Though an apology was later given, Murugan Kanna, organiser of the Tamil Nadu Untouchabilty Eradication Front in Tirunelveli, filed a complaint after Thamizh Mani, the Tirumangalam candidate of the Naam Tamizhar party, publicly invoked his caste and threw expletives on a thread on Facebook.

According to Mr. Murugan, he wrote a small note on the Jawaharlal Nehru University protests and made remarks on the politics of the Sangh Parivar. Mr. Murugan said the act was a crime under the Prevention of Atrocities Act, which he has asked the Tirunelveli police to invoke.

‘Unprovoked’

Mr. Murugan said he had not mentioned anything about Mr. Thamizh or his party. “The response was unprovoked,” he said.

When contacted, Naam Tamizhar founder Seeman said he would immediately look into the issue and would ask the person to apologise.

“If the complaint is true, I would like to make it clear the party does not encourage such acts. I will immediately deal with it,” he assured.

He says the party candidate

hurled expletives

at him on

Facebook
title: Dalit activist’s allegation against Naam Tamizhar candidate
